p.span: Displays one or more concept (with hedges) as an area chart. This command is a "generating" command, which means it must be run as the first command.
xsDisplayConcept [hedge]* concept FROM context [IN container] [BY class] [SCOPED scope] [; [hedge]* concept FROM context [IN container] [BY class] [SCOPED scope]]* [USING synonyms]
| xsDisplayConcept somewhat tall FROM Height; not very short FROM Height
Displays the hedged concepts 'tall' and 'short' from the context 'Height' in the container 'Height'.
concept, hedge, context, container, class, scope
The hedge to be applied to the concept. You may specify as many hedges as you like.
The container the context is stored.
The scope (private, app, global) where the container is stored.
The concept(s) is displayed in table or chart format. See xsCreateDDContext or xsCreateUDContext for details about creating a Context.
